page.title: 01Broughton Gifford and Holt
page.content: The centre of this area, situated west of Melksham, is the historic house of Great Chalfield. Broughton Gifford is situated in the east, in the middle of a triangle of main roads, reached only by narrow country lanes. The north and west is entirely agricultural land and farms. On the southern edge the small town of Holt straddles the A3107. The nearest large towns are Bath 10 miles west, Trowbridge 5 miles south and Chippenham 8 miles north-east. EMPLOYMENT The people living in this area are employed in agriculture or travel to larger towns nearby to work in light industry, the Civil Service and the associated services.
